data.title: Film choice
data.meta_description: SaturdayGET SHORTY (1995)Five, 11pmThe crime writer Elmore Leonard’s hard-boiled bestseller about Hollywood lowlife becomes a boisterous, colourful big- screen farce in the hands of Barry Sonnenfeld
data.text:
Saturday

GET SHORTY (1995)

Five, 11pm

The crime writer Elmore Leonard’s hard-boiled bestseller about Hollywood lowlife becomes a boisterous, colourful big- screen farce in the hands of Barry Sonnenfeld. John Travolta exudes both toughness and charm as the Miami enforcer turned movie mogul Chili Palmer. Gene Hackman, Danny DeVito and Rene Russo also shine in sharply observed movie-biz roles, while Leonard’s busy plot involves Colombian drug barons, comic-book violence and numerous celebrity cameos. (105min)

LEAVING LAS VEGAS (1995)

ITV1, 11.15pm

Winning an Oscar for Nicolas Cage, Leaving Las Vegas is a symphony in boozy melancholy from the British director Mike Figgis. Cage plays Ben, a grief- stricken screenwriter who resolves to drink himself to death. Elisabeth Shue gives an equally impressive performance as a Vegas
